holidays.name: Love Soy Milk Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the creamy, nutritious goodness of soy milk, the plant-based drink that’s perfect for vegans, lactose-intolerant folks, or anyone looking for a dairy alternative.
holidays.origin: Originated from soy milk producers and health advocates to promote soy milk awareness and its benefits.
holidays.funFact: Soy milk has been consumed for over 2,000 years, especially in East Asia, and is packed with protein and is lactose-free!

holidays.name: Aunt and Uncle's Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration to honor those unsung heroes in your family who are your aunts and uncles.
holidays.origin: Popularized in the early 2000s by family-interest groups to recognize the special role aunts and uncles play in our lives.
holidays.funFact: Studies show children with close relationships to their aunts and uncles have stronger emotional support systems!

holidays.name: All or Nothing Day
holidays.description: A playful day encouraging folks to take bold risks or go for their dreams with ‘all or nothing’ attitude.
holidays.origin: Created by motivational speakers to inspire people to overcome fear and hesitation.
holidays.funFact: The phrase ‘all or nothing’ originally appeared in English in the late 19th century, often linked to gambling or high-stakes decisions.

holidays.name: One Voice Day
holidays.description: An unusual awareness day that promotes coming together to speak as one on issues like peace, justice, or environmental causes.
holidays.origin: Started by activist groups to inspire unified action and solidarity across communities worldwide.
holidays.funFact: ‘One Voice’ is often associated with choral groups and singing in harmony, symbolizing unity in diversity.
